result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha H Easton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 AMENDED FROM Felony Theft, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AMENDED 05-16-2016:  Length of probation amended to one year as allowed per statute.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample and pay for the testing.  Defendant must pay court costs and the cost of supervision.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.  
Pay restitution to mother. 
Expungment ordered if defendant successfully completes probation.

***AMENDED 5/13/16:  DEFENSE COUNSEL TO DRAFT AN ORDER REGARDING THE TITLE OF THE VEHICLE

Counsel to draft order re: title of vehicle

Attorney Gretchen Grace Rosenke in court.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter:  Magie Brady.
Defendant not present.   Offer has been extended; defendant expected to accept.  Attorney requests any warrant be stayed.  
BTC: BW authorized; stayed 48 hours
Victim present.  DMV is requiring order/letter to allow victim to register car in her name.
Victim to write letter to the Court with all information regarding the car and herself.  Also get information from DMV of exactly what they will require.   Court will then consider.
Warrant vacated; plea hearing is scheduled for 05/03.  Court will also deal with the car issue.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Samantha H Easton in court with attorney Gretchen Grace Rosenke.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Samantha H Easton in court with attorney Gretchen Grace Rosenke. Bridget Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim T.A.B. (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Samantha H Easton in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Samantha H Easton in custody.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
BTC: Vacate warrant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Warrant forwarded to RPD for entry.
Restitution request - provided by Victim Witness.  VI:  T.B.    No amount given - victim information only
